rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses neutral language ('China has reported 21 human infections') without high-potency verbs or metaphors.
The verb 'has reported' is not a moderate verb.
No loaded rhetorical question is present in the text.
The segment reports a fact/statistic but does not contain explicit calming language.
The segment does not contain a minimiser used in conjunction with a scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
Reports the numerical metric '21 human infections... so far this year, more than in the whole of 2020' using the standard verb 'reported'.
